attributes.comment:
I am 100% totally opposed to the proposal to increase USCIS filing fees of any
kind noted in Docket Number (USCIS-2006-0044). My husband I are in the process
of adopting our second daughter from China. Adoption is expensive enough
already and this would add yet another roadblock to keep parents from bringing
home children who otherwise might live their lives in a foreign orphanage (well
at least until they are teenagers and can, in some countries, be turned out onto
the street). Because China is so slow in giving referrals at this time we
already know we will have to renew all our USCIS forms and our fingerprints.
What in the world do fingerprints have to be renewed anyway? They don?t change
so why should they expire?! It is unconscionable for the government to raise
fees by up to 66% for adoption-related petitions. Immigrants who are here
legally and are seeking to obtain citizenship and to follow proper procedures
under USCIS are only punished by raised fees. This entire country save for the
Native Americans came here as immigrants! I agree that we do need to make
changes so that illegal immigrants are returned to their countries, however, the
ones who are here legally should not have to be punished because the US does not
have in place measure to keep out or deport illegal immigrants when they are
discovered! Maybe someone should think of a way to require a deportment fee
from illegal immigrants. That way the government might be more interested in
finding ways to get the illegal immigrants out instead of charging more to those
of us who are adopting or to those who are here legally.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Carmi Henderson
